description: February 28, 2020, the São Paulo government launches an online information campaign to combat misinformation related to COVID-19.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 24, 2020, the holder of Sespa recommended that people from Pará access the page created by the Ministry of Health to combat fake news and use the whatsapp provided by the Ministry of Health: (61) 99289-4640, to clarify doubts.
“On the page, there is accurate, quality and credible information. In case of doubt, access the official websites of the Ministry of Health and Sespa. We have a collection of examples of fake news there and the truth about each one, because the best way to combat false news is with quality information, ”said Beltrame.

The role of the State Civil Police is also essential in the face of the spread of fake news. According to the general delegate of the PC, Alberto Teixeira, the work of the corporation is intense to investigate the content of these messages, with the objective of identifying who are the disseminators of these false news, so that they are held criminally responsible.

“We set up a team that is analyzing this information, so that we can identify and hold these people accountable, based on Article 41 of the Criminal Misdemeanor Law, which provides for punishment for those who use this device, as well as the Brazilian Penal Code and other legal provisions ”, He guaranteed. 

Update - Sespa released the update of the Covid-19 Balance in Pará at 11am this Tuesday (24th). The State continues with five confirmed cases, 215 discarded and 168 cases under analysis.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Brazil, 25th March 2020. To combat the proliferation of these fake news, the Secretariat of State for Communication i Alagoas(Secom) will make available, starting this Wednesday (25th), on the Alagoas Agency website, a fact-checking service. The content of videos, audios and posts will be analyzed daily.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)

description: In Para, Brazil in compliance with the actions to prevent contagion by the new Coronavirus (Covid-19), the Government of Pará suspends, starting this Wednesday (18), until March 31, classes in the state elementary and high school system, and also in technical schools and at the State University of Pará (Uepa). Only the distribution of school meals will be maintained, and students will be able to pick it up daily where they are enrolled, at the same time it is served at school. The suspension of classes is a provisional measure, but may be extended if necessary.

description: On April 1, the President of Brazil enacted a provisional measure (MP 934) allowing shcools of basic and higher education to have less than 200 days of classes for the school year of 2020, but in some cases keeping the minimum of 800 hours. This measure also allows classes of the degrees of medicine, pharmacy, nursing and physiotherapy to reduce their shcool days; however, students who are attending curricular internships must accomplish to a minimum of 75% of their obligations to the activities as interns.

description: On June 4, 2020, Decree from Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) government "establishes the rules applicable to educational institutions, in accordance with measures to prevent and deal with the epidemic caused by the new Coronavirus". The measures will take effect on June 15, allowing establishments to carry out classroom activities, educational support or care for children and adolescents, depending on the conditions, the operating ceiling, the operation mode and the other limits, restrictions and measures defined in the specific legislation.

description: On March 17, the Brazilian Ministry of Education signed a decree (Portaria 343) authorizing higher education institutes to substitute classroom classes to virtual ones, excepct for the degree of Medicine. Additionally, the measure states that, instead of virtual classes, these can be suspended for the same period. This measure had already received updates on April 16 and May 15 extending the validity for thirty days more in both cases. description: On April 1, the President of Brazil enacted a provisional measure (MP 934) allowing shcools of basic and higher education to have less than 200 days of classes for the school year of 2020, but in some cases keeping the minimum of 800 hours. This measure also allows classes of the degrees of medicine, pharmacy, nursing and physiotherapy to reduce their shcool days; however, students who are attending curricular internships must accomplish to a minimum of 75% of their obligations to the activities as interns. UPDATE: On July 29, the Brazilian Senate extended the due date of the provisional measure by sending to the President of Brazil a modified text which should be revised by him in order to be transformed in an Act.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Non-essential workers (please note their occupation in the text entry where applicable),Other population not specifed above

This measure had had an update validating it until August 4. UPDATE: On August 3, the Brazilian Ministry of Education signed a new decree (Portaria 617) in order to extend the term of the policy that authorizes technical schools from federal education institutes and professional education institutes to have non physical classes, or to suspend these.

description: On April 1, the President of Brazil enacted a provisional measure (MP 934) allowing shcools of basic and higher education to have less than 200 days of classes for the school year of 2020, but in some cases keeping the minimum of 800 hours. This measure also allows classes of the degrees of medicine, pharmacy, nursing and physiotherapy to reduce their shcool days; however, students who are attending curricular internships must accomplish to a minimum of 75% of their obligations to the activities as interns. This had had an update validating it until August 18. UPDATE: On August 18, the Brazilian congress enacted the "14.040/2020" Act which was originally a provisional measure regarding school days for 2020. The text approved and sanctioned by the President of Brazil included the following changes: the students of the course of odontology that are attending curricular internships must accomplish a minimum of 75% of the hours; and, all technical high school courses that are related to the fight against the pandemic can anticipate its graduation since at least 75% of the hours of the mandatory internship was accomplished by the students.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On April 3, the Brazilian Ministry of Education signed a decree (Portaria 376) authorizing technical schools from federal education institutes and professional edcuation institutes to adopt non physical classes, or to suspend these. UPDATE: On December 30th 2020, the Brazilian Ministry of Education signed a new decree (Portaria 1.096) which establishes the return to in-person classes date to March 1st 2021 for federal high school institutes (including private higher education institutes that offer technical education at high school level). It also allows the exceptional use of digital educational resources to cover the workload of pedagogical activities if not met by in-person classes. Allows the anticipation of course completion (only for technical courses in the health area) for federal university students.

description: Announced on the 27th of January, 2021, the state of Rio de Janeiro announced that presencial classes will return on the 24th of February through 3 phases. description: Brazil is enforcing entry screening from high risk countries in Asia. Brazil s Ministry of Health announced on Friday, February 21, that it has expanded quarantine measures for travelers arriving from several Asian countries showing symptoms of coronavirus  COVID-19 . Travelers arriving from China, Japan, South Korea, North Korea, Singapore, Vietnam, Thailand, and Cambodia showing signs of COVID-19 will be placed under quarantine until they are confirmed to be free of the virus.

description:
On March 27, 2020 Brazil government announceexceptional and temporary restrictions on the entry of foreigners into the country, in accordance with the provisions of item VI of art. 3 of Law No. 13,979, of February 6, 2020.

Art. 2
In addition to the provisions of Interministerial Ordinance No. 133, of March 23, 2020, the entry of foreigners into the country, regardless of nationality, in international transit by air, is prohibited when the country of destination or nationality does not admit its air, land or waterway ticket.

Art. 3
Airline companies must prevent foreigners from embarking to Brazil in the situation provided for in Art. 2."

description: On April 1, 2020, Brazil government announce Rio de Janeiro flight suspensions. Most commercial flights at Rio de Janeiro-Galeo International Airport  GIG  will be suspended as of Wednesday, April 1, until April 30, due to the ongoing coronavirus disease  COVID-19  pandemic. GIG will also be closed daily between 23 00 and 05 00  local time . description:
Considering the Emergency health declaration my the World Health Organization (WHO) the following countries are temporarily blocked from entry into Brazilian territory: ARG, BOL, COL, GUF, GIN, PRY, PER, SUR, starting from 19 July, 2020. 

This declaration does not apply to Brazilian citizens, an international worker authorized by the Brazilian government, or an immigrant with authorized residence in Brazil. This directive also does not apply for the transport of goods through highways, the traffic of residents of twin cities with an exclusively land border line, and humanitarian efforts authorized by local authorities.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description:
Brazil government on July 22, 2020 announce "The temporary restriction of international travelers through highways and ground transport from the Oriental Republic of Uruguay for the next 30 days, subject to change at the discretion of ""Agência Nacional de Vigilância Sanitária"" - Anvisa.

This declaration does not apply if the individual seeking entry is of Brazilian nationality, who's partner is of Brazilian nationality, to the Uruguayan with a Brazilian child, to the foreigner who's residence is in Brazil, foreigner working for an international or national organization and possesses identification and is accredited by the Brazilian government. 

This decree also does not apply for the transport of goods through highways, humanitarian efforts authorized by local authorities and the movement of residents in bordering countries who can provide documentation of residency."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: On July 29, 2020 Brazil lifted previous air travel restrictions. Foreigners of all nationalities are allowed to enter the country by air, provided that the migratory requirements appropriate to their condition are met, including the possession of an entry visa, when required by the Brazilian legal system. Additionally, foreign passengers on visits to the country of up to ninety days, shall submit to the carrier, before boarding, proof of purchase of health insurance valid in Brazil and with coverage for the entire period of the trip. These restrictions were announced to last 30 days, effective immediately.

description: From 29 July, Brazil has officially reopened its borders to international travel, which had been banned since March. However, an additional 30 days ban on the entry of foreigners by land (unless for transit) and sea has been extended.    The borders are open to nationals, residents, and tourists. Non-resident foreigners can enter for a period not exceeding 90 days and must show proof of the purchase of valid health insurance in Brazil with coverage for the entire period of travel. This insurance is required for each of the passengers traveling to Brazil, however, does not apply to:    * Brazilian citizens  * Foreigners residing in Brazil  * International transit passengers (as long as they remain in the departure lounge)
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On July 29, 2020 Brazil lifted previous air travel restrictions. Foreigners of all nationalities are allowed to enter the country by air, provided that the migratory requirements appropriate to their condition are met, including the possession of an entry visa, when required by the Brazilian legal system. Additionally, foreign passengers on visits to the country of up to ninety days, shall submit to the carrier, before boarding, proof of purchase of health insurance valid in Brazil and with coverage for the entire period of the trip. These restrictions were announced to last 30 days, effective immediately. UPDATE: Restrictions were set to last until August 28, 2020, but on August 26 , 2020, a 30 day extension was announced, effective immediately.

description: On January 2, 2021 The Superior Court of Justice of Brazil (STJ) denied a request to suspend the requirement of negative PCR tests from people entering the country (Ordinance no. 630/2020). Two Brazilians in Punta Cana, with tickets to return to the country, requested the annulment as there were no tests available in the Dominican Republic.    In the decision, the President of the Superior Court of Justice, Justice Humberto Martins, stated that “it is not reasonable to allow passengers to board without complying with the restrictions imposed exceptionally and temporarily by the authorities considered to be coercive, to the detriment of the community”.

description: On May 28, 2021 Brazil government announced ordinance  no. 654/2021 from the federal government maintained borders closed for land and water transportation indefinitely. It also stated the prohibition of international flights originating in or passing through the UK, Northern Ireland, South Africa and India, and the requirement for Brazilians coming from those regions in the last fourteen days to quarantine. The norm established sanitary protocols for airline crews. People entering the country from abroad through air transportation must present a negative PCR test. Foreigners coming from or who have passed through, in the last 14 days, the UK, Northern Ireland, South Africa and India are not allowed to enter the country.

description:
The organs and entities that are part of SIPEC will suspend the realization of international trips for the service while the state of emergency of public health of international importance resulting from the coronavirus (COVID-19) persists.

At the discretion of the Minister of State or the highest authority of the entity, international service travel may be authorized during the period referred to in the caput, by means of an individual justification for travel, delegation to the Executive Secretary or, in the case of an autarchy or public foundation, to the unit holder with competence in the area of ​​people management, sub-delegation prohibited. 

The organs and entities that are part of the SIPEC should carefully re-evaluate the need for domestic travel on service while the public health emergency of international importance resulting from the coronavirus (COVID-19) continues.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
On January 29, 2020, State health authorities, airport administration, and National Health Surveillance Agency representants aligned actions on possible suspected cases of coronavirus entering Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) by air. 

Since 28 January, The Ministry of Health started to consider as a criterion for a suspicious case the person who has been in any region of China in the last 14 days and who, on returning to Brazil, presents with fever and some other respiratory symptom (cough or difficulty breathing) .

description:
Amazonas and São Paulo are the Brazilian states selected to integrate the project of epidemiological surveillance and monitoring of biosafety practices against Covid-19 in hospitals, starting in August. The initiative is the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in the United States and is led by the Amazonas Health Surveillance Foundation (FVS-AM).

The project works to improve screening practices in emergency rooms to care for patients with different diagnoses, including those with severe acute flu syndrome (SRAG) and Covid-19. The strategy observes preventive actions against the in-hospital Covid-19 transmission.

According to the director-president of the FVS-AM, Rosemary Costa Pinto, the action will be important to emphasize the good practices of prevention and control of infection already practiced in the state. "These are improvements in preventing the transmission of Covid-19 and serve as an example for other locations," he said.

The coordinator of the Commission and Services for Infection Control Related to Health Care (Ceciss), from FVS-AM, Tatyana Amorim, pointed out that the improvements include different approaches. "The improvements include the screening of outpatients, visitors, and monitoring of health professionals and inpatients," he said.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On Feb.28, the Pernambuco Secretary for Health, André Longo, announced that Governor Paulo Câmara will submit a bill to the Legislative Assembly of the State of Pernambuco (Alepe) to create 120 new positions for the Hospital Universitário Oswaldo Cruz (Huoc), a reference for the care of adults coronavirus suspects. The objective is to reinforce the staff of professionals with infectious disease doctors and nurses, day laborers, and on duty, already approved in public contests held by SES-PE and the University of Pernambuco (UPE).
In addition,  R$ 120,000 was transferred to HUOC and the same amount to Correia Picanço Hospital (reference for the child care). The amount will be used to purchase inputs and personal protective equipment (PPE). SES-PE is already making an emergency purchase of inputs to keep its network prepared and supplied for possible assistance to the population. This process will have an investment of approximately R $ 1 million.
 UPDATE: The started day was 02/28, not 03/28
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 24, 2020, State Governor Helder Barbalho signed a contract with a company from São Paulo, which operates in the infrastructure and engineering sector, to set up field hospitals that will serve patients with covid-19. Four temporary hospital structures will be installed: one in Belém (RMB), one in Marabá (Carajás region), another in Santarém (Tapajós region) and one in Breves (Marajó). Altogether there are 720 more beds being offered in the public health network. Each bed will cost, on average, R $ 5,000 for the State. 

In contract, the company presented an architectural project based on ABNT (Brazilian Association of Technical Standards) standards and other regulations of the Ministry of Labor. In it, the company suggests installing field hospitals in Convention Centers or similar structures. But it also makes it clear that the project can be changed if another type of
space is made available. Field hospitals must operate in Pará for a minimum of 120 days.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On Feb.28, the Pernambuco Secretary for Health, André Longo, announced that Governor Paulo Câmara will submit a bill to the Legislative Assembly of the State of Pernambuco (Alepe) to create 120 new positions for the Hospital Universitário Oswaldo Cruz (Huoc), a reference for the care of adults coronavirus suspects. The objective is to reinforce the staff of professionals with infectious disease doctors and nurses, day laborers, and on duty, already approved in public contests held by SES-PE and the University of Pernambuco (UPE).
In addition,  R$ 120,000 was transferred to HUOC and the same amount to Correia Picanço Hospital (reference for the child care). The amount will be used to purchase inputs and personal protective equipment (PPE). SES-PE is already making an emergency purchase of inputs to keep its network prepared and supplied for possible assistance to the population. This process will have an investment of approximately R $ 1 million.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: 2nd April 2020. Governor João Doria announced, on Thursday (2nd), the expansion of the capacity to make protective masks against the coronavirus (which causes the disease COVID-19) in prison units in São Paulo. The goal is to reach a daily production of more than 50 thousand masks, which will be used by civil servants who work to combat the pandemic.The manufacture of disposable protective masks, for use in non-surgical procedures, is already underway in the three prison units in Tremembé. As of this Friday (3), production will also start in prisons in the cities of Araraquara, Itaí, Tupi Paulista and Andradina. UPDATE: Capacity increased, program expanded
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On April 24, 2020, the State Secretariat for Planning and Administration (Seplad), will distribute to the population 230,000 masks, which were purchased from seamstresses, individual microentrepreneurs and small businesses, through the program “Mask for Everyone”. 

After the publication of the Special Public Notice of Public Call 001/2020 to carry out the purchases, Seplad received 1,885 registrations from those interested in selling homemade masks and after document analysis, 511 were qualified for the next phase, of which 423 were seamstresses - individuals and 88 individual entrepreneurs and micro-enterprises.

description: On 6/23/2020, as a way of reducing the social and economic impacts of the Covid-19 pandemic among the population in extreme poverty, 260 families in the municipality of Codajás (240 kilometers from Manaus) are benefiting from the “Citizen Support” program, created by the Government do Amazonas and managed by the State Secretariat of Social Assistance (Seas).Each of the program's beneficiaries, selected from the Federal Government's Single Registry, has the right to receive three installments of R $ 200 (April, May and June), totaling R $ 600 in three months, for the purchase of basket items basic and hygiene and cleaning material. The objective of “Citizen Support” is to guarantee food security and prevent the spread of Covid-19, especially in the most vulnerable population.

description:
On Friday, August 14, 580 families from the municipality of Boa Vista do Ramos (269 kilometers from Manaus) received the donation of basic baskets and hygiene kits during emergency action by the Government of Amazonas, through the State Secretariat of Social Assistance (Seas) and the Fund for Social Promotion and Poverty Eradication (FPS).

 The activity, which is part of the policy to face the social and economic effects of the Covid-19 pandemic, followed the determination of Governor Wilson Lima. The delivery took place in the sports court of the State School Gecília Barbosa.

 Seas' secretary, Maricília Costa, coordinated the work together with the teams from the Municipal Social Assistance Secretariat (Semas). At school, the safety and prevention protocols for Covid-19 were obeyed, with the distribution of masks, social distance and the offer of gel alcohol to the population.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On May 6, 2020, Brazil's Ministry of Health launched the "Diagnosticar para Cuidar" (Diagnose to Care) program that seeks to increase the country's testing capabilities and test 22% of the population. The program is divided into two "fronts": "Confirma COVID-19" (Confirm Covid-19) will use a PCR test only on symptomatic patients, while "Testa Brasil" (Test Brazil) seeks to leverage the use of rapid tests in order to understand the progression of the virus in the country.

description:
On July 2, 2020, the government of Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) announces that it "will carry out another 3 thousand new tests daily between July and August. Thus, it will reach 4 thousand since currently there are already about a thousand tests per day".

FIRST STAGE - Second half of July
1st testing group: all workers and residents of a long-term care facility for the elderly, symptomatic or asymptomatic.
2nd testing group: all workers in health facilities, symptomatic or asymptomatic, after confirmation of a case.
3rd testing group: all people who show flu-like symptoms residing in the Metropolitan Region, in the North and in the Serra.

SECOND STAGE - Early August
4th group: all people who show flu-like symptoms residing in other regions of the State.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

The Technical Assistance and Rural Extension Company of the State of Pará (Emater), through the Coordination of Administration and Development of Human Resources (Codes) and in partnership with the State Department of Public Health (Sespa), carried out this Wednesday , August 12, 2020 testing for the new coronavirus on servers located at the main office, in Marituba, Metropolitan Region of Belém. description:
The Amazonas Health Surveillance Foundation (FVS-AM) carried out, in three days (18 to 20/08), 534 rapid tests for Covid-19 diagnosis in education professionals in Manaus. Of this total, 162 (30%) tested positive and were taken off for isolation. The result, according to FVS-AM, shows that the percentage of contaminated follows the average recorded in the first week, in tests by other professionals, such as in the areas of safety (36%) and health (38%), which subsequently presented rate reduction.

The results of the rapid tests, the active surveillance work with education professionals and the epidemiological situation of Covid-19 in Amazonas were presented, this Friday afternoon (08/21), by the president-director of FVS-AM, Rosemary da Costa Pinto, to representatives of the Public Prosecutor's Office (MPE) and Federal (MPF), the Public Prosecutor's Office (MPT) and the Public Defender's Office (DPE), in addition to the Union of Workers in Education (Sinteam).

Rapid tests for education professionals began to be carried out by the Government of Amazonas last Tuesday. In three days, 534 professionals were tested, of which 162 were positive, of which 139 had positive IGM and IGG, which indicates that, although they already have antibodies to Covid-19, the virus remains active. As established in the protocol for resuming face-to-face classes, professionals who tested positive were removed for the necessary isolation period.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Certificates of gratitude and recognition were delivered today (13) by the Governor of Pará, Helder Barbalho, to workers who participated in the hygiene and disinfection of streets and fairs in the Metropolitan Region of Belém. The action, carried out since the 3rd, was a coping strategy to Covid-19.

According to Arthur Houat, ombudsman-general of the State, the planned structure was only possible with the support of all the bodies involved and the drivers. “The team came from the city of Capitão Poço, where the headquarters of the company that provided the equipment is located. It was a gesture of solidarity to carry out the activity, so this was a way for us to return and thank everyone who came to provide this service ”.

description:
The Integrated Committee of Public Security Managers of Pará (Cigesp) approved, on Tuesday morning (31), resolution 001/2020, which creates an internal crisis office, within the scope of State Public Security, to define actions and building guidelines to combat covid-19 in Pará. The meeting was held by videoconference, in the plenary of the Secretariat of Public Security and Defense Socia (Segup).

“The members of the State Security Council of the State assessed the need to create an internal public security office so that we could, in a unified way, define guidelines to manage the crisis resulting from the new coronavirus pandemic. Through it we will set goals, assess needs and find solutions that can be presented to the State Government's official crisis office, which was set up as soon as the first case arose, to combat the spread of the virus in the territory of Pará ”, explained the secretary of Public Security of the State, Ualame Machado. The crisis office implemented by public security managers will consist of four specific action fronts, divided into the following working groups: Operational, Intelligence, Social Communication and Monitoring - the latter being in charge of evaluating the results undertaken by the office.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: Existing government entity given new powers
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On July 6, 2020, the Integrated Inspection Center (CIF), coordinated by the Amazonas Public Security Secretariat (SSP-AM), intensified land and river actions, with inspections in bars, nightclubs and floating in the city to check the compliance with preventive measures against the new coronavirus. The action went through several neighborhoods in the capital of Amazonas.
In total, 23 establishments were banned by the CIF teams, made up of public security and control bodies from the Government of Amazonas and the Prefecture of Manaus. 
In addition, 17 received an infraction notice for the absence or delay of mandatory documents. Also during the land action, 55 infraction notices were issued for irregular parking.The Deputy Executive Secretariat for Integrated Planning and Management (Seagi), of SSP-AM, Military and Civil Police, Amazonas Military Fire Brigade (CBMAM), Municipal Health Surveillance (Visa Manaus), Municipal Institute of Urban Mobility ( Immu), in addition to other inspection and control bodies of the State Government and Manaus Prefecture.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description:
The Amazonas State Department of Health (SES-AM) and the Health Surveillance Foundation (FVS) presented the state health restructuring program, 'Saúde Amazonas', to the Special Secretariat for Federative Affairs (SEAF), linked to the Secretariat Government (SEGOV) of the Federal Government. The information was presented, on the afternoon of Tuesday (6/10), through videoconference, in which the epidemiological panorama of the situation of Covid-19 in the State was also presented.

In addition to the holder of SES-AM, Marcellus Campêlo, the president of FVS, Rosemery Costa Pinto, participated in the action. Representing the Federal Government, Julio Alexandre Menezes, Sérgio Lisboa, Tatiane Moraes, and Márcia Maria Rocha of the Special Secretariat for Federative Affairs of the Government Secretariat (SEAF / SEGOV) participated in the meeting.

The 'Saúde Amazonas' launched by Governor Wilson Lima has an initial investment estimated at R $ 1.4 billion by 2022. One of the priorities is the reduction of the waiting list for exams and consultations in the state network, with an increase of 65% provision of procedures in the next six months.

Secretary Marcellus Campêlo, led the meeting and presented the nine main axes that guide the Health Amazonas program and the actions already taken since the launch, at the end of August, to improve the services offered by SES-AM.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
In order to reduce the waiting time for exams and consultations necessary to perform any surgical modality, the “Pre-Operative Rapid” Program, developed by the Government of Pará, through the State Department of Public Health (Sespa), it is one more action to speed up procedures and zero queues across Pará.
According to Rômulo Rodovalho, holder of Sespa, the program, launched last Thursday (15) , has already carried out 142 calls at the Metropolitan Polyclinic. The goal is to provide 100 daily consultations, from Monday to Friday, from 7 am to 7 pm, with a total offer of 2 thousand visits per month to paraenses who have surgical indication and are unable to proceed with the preoperative procedures.

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Continuing its commitment to actions to combat Covid-19, the Government of Amazonas, through the State Research Support Foundation (Fapeam), launched this Friday (11/27) the 2nd Call of the CT&I Program in the Public Health Emergencies in Amazonas - Covid 19 (PCTI-EmergeSaúde / AM), to support research in the fight against the new coronavirus and the consequences of the pandemic in the state. The announcement was made by Fapeam's CEO, Márcia Perales, during the   launch live .

“We have good researchers in this area, taking into account the experience that we have in dealing with other viruses and that we have advanced in this direction. We have already launched a first public notice for this research purpose and today we have launched another one, through Fapeam, making these researchers available ”, said the governor of Amazonas, Wilson Lima, during a press conference on Thursday (11/26) ).

This is the second call made this year to support research projects and / or strategic services that subsidize the Public Health Policy in the State of Amazonas, with application of the results on issues related to the Covid-19 pandemic. The call focuses on three thematic lines: health; education; information and communication technology. This time the investment is R $ 8,904,016.00.

description:
Even after the Covid-19 viral cycle, many patients still have sequelae and need follow-up to fully recover from the disease. The Post-Covid Screening Program, created by the State Department of Public Health (Sespa), operating in the Metropolitan Polyclinic, is a strategy to guarantee this type of health care for people from Pará.

According to Rômulo Rodovalho, holder of Sespa, the goal of the program is to offer 130 consultations per day, of which 50 vacancies for men, 50 for women and 30 for child care, with a total of 2,600 visits per month.

description: On May 10, 2020, Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) "institutes the Controlled Distance System for the purpose of preventing and dealing with the epidemic caused by the new Coronavirus". The monitoring of the evolution of the epidemic will be carried out with the assessment of eleven indicators designed to measure the spread of COVID-19 and the service capacity of the health system. The result of the measurement of the indicators will be classified, according to the score, into four Flags, which will be used for the gradual and proportional application of a set of measures.

description: Minas Gerais sets requirements for hospitals. Patients must be given their own rooms, and prior to any procedures must be kept at home for fourteen days. Surgeons must have a negative covid test 7 days prior to any operation. A companion may be present as long as the patient has completed 14 day quarantine. Patient must sign consent form. Procedure must be postponed for 10 days if patient has respiratory symptoms and must be tested 3-7 days after onset. If tested positive, patient must isolate for 10 days, and will be considered recovered if after 10 days they do not have symptoms or have two negative tests.

description:
Brazil, 18th March 2020. The Government of Alagoas announced the launch of a public service campaign that will be broadcast on newspapers, TVs, radio stations, websites, social networks and in places with large numbers of people. 
The campaign will have two main focuses. The first will provide information on personal hygiene procedures in order to ensure the individual's health and to prevent the spread of the virus to other people. The second will be the presentation of a flow chart with guidelines for people who have symptoms such as cough, runny nose and difficulty breathing. “In that case, they need to go to a health center. Who will identify the need to do the test for Covid-19 is the doctor ”
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description:
The Covid-19 Daily Bulletin of the Health Surveillance Foundation of Amazonas (FVS-AM), edition nº 237, released this Thursday (11/26), brings the diagnosis of 916 new cases of Covid-19, totaling 176,214 cases of the disease in the state.

Also according to the bulletin, 30 deaths were confirmed by Covid-19, 14 of which occurred on 11/25 and 16 deaths were terminated by clinical, imaging, clinical-epidemiological or laboratory criteria, bringing the total number of deaths to 4,856.

The bulletin adds that 20,871 people diagnosed with Covid-19 are being followed up by the municipal health departments, which corresponds to 11.84% of confirmed active cases.

Hospital Network -  Among the confirmed cases of Covid-19 in Amazonas, there are 384 hospitalized patients, 230 in clinical beds (62 in the private network and 168 in the public network), 148 in the ICU (38 in the private network and 110 in the public network) and six in a red room, a structure dedicated to temporary assistance to stabilize critical / severe patients for later referral to other points in the health care network.

There are also 47 other hospitalized patients considered suspect and awaiting confirmation of the diagnosis. Of these, 27 are in clinical beds (23 in the private network and four in the public network), 18 are in the ICU (16 in the private network and two in the public network) and two in the red room.

Notification -  The bulletin is constructed with the information made available daily by the city
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On Tuesday afternoon (17/03), Normative Ordinance No. 003/2020, which deals with preventive measures and temporary measures to reduce the risk of contagion from the coronavirus, caused by Covid-19.

The ordinance, which goes into effect this Tuesday, suspends for 15 days the face-to-face service for the registration of Police Reports (BOs) in the Integrated Civil Police Districts (DIPs) and specialized police stations, and the procedure must be done by through the 'Interactive Police Station' platform, in non-emergency cases.

Face-to-face assistance will only be accepted in cases of vehicle theft, perishing of evidence, homicides and removal of corpses, flagrant arrest records and other cases that are at the discretion of the police authority and that are configured as an emergency.

The document, which covers all sectors of the General Police Station, DIPs, Specialized, Sectional and special groups (Beast, Denarc and DRCO), also says that it is prohibited to “refer victims of crime to public hospitals to obtain medical care. , except for the need for medical intervention in emergency cases ”.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Brazil, March 29th 2020. State of Alagoas. According to the new decree, it is suspended, in the state territory, until zero hours on Tuesday (April 7), and the operation of bars, restaurants, cafeterias and similar establishments may be extended at the end of this period; museums, cinemas and other cultural facilities, public and private; temples, churches and other religious institutions, with only internal functioning being authorized.
The operation of gyms, clubs, fitness centers and similar establishments also remains suspended; stores or establishments that do business or provide services of a private nature; shopping centers, galleries, shopping centers and similar establishments, except for supermarkets, pharmacies and places that provide health services within these places. Events and exhibitions remain prohibited. UPDATE: Original order for closure was until April 3rd, it has been extended until April 7th
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
On March 19th, 2020, in Alagoas, Brazil, the state's governor declared the suspension and closing of movie theaters and gyms for 15 days. Bars and restaurants are only allowed to open if a minimal distance of 1 meter is kept between tables.
 UPDATE: The original order for closure only included cinemas and gyms and restricted the distances between tables in bars and restaurants. New update now fully suspends activities in bars and restaurants, any cultural spaces such as cinemas, theaters, museums, etc., gyms and other similar establishments, commercial establishments, and shopping centers for eight days starting on March 30.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
Announced 1 April, effective for 15 days. 

According to the Municipality, the measure will initially be valid for 15 days and includes the shutdown of the BRT articulated buses, trunk lines and feeders, in addition to the closure of all stations and the Maracacuera, Tapanã, Mangueirão and São Brás terminals. In addition, the city also reported that it suspended, on average, 60% of the entire public transport system by bus in Belém as a preventive measure to covid-19. 

“The suspension of the BRT, together with the reduction in the bus fleet in the city, can directly damage the population, such as, for example, the increase in the capacity of the collective, the accumulation of people at the stops and inside the vehicles, in addition to the worsening in the service provided ”, added the attorney general.

description: On May 10, 2020, Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) "institutes the Controlled Distance System for the purpose of preventing and dealing with the epidemic caused by the new Coronavirus". It makes mandatory to every establishment, private or public, the observation of sanitary measures. Establishments must adopt schedules and shift changes systems to reduce the number of employees at the same time, as well as offer exclusive hours or sectors to serve customers aged sixty or over and those at risk.

description: On July 21st, Rio de Janeiro announced that malls are allowed to open from 10 am to 10 pm, and are limited to 2/3 of total capacity. Hand sanitizer must be available, circulation must be present, people must stay one to two meters apart. Playgrounds are limited to 1/3 capacity and children under 3 are not allowed. Table and seat capacity, as well as parking capacity is limited to 2/3 of total capacity

description:
Government of Amazonas published Decree No. 42,794, of September 24, 2020, with the new complementary measures to confront Covid-19 in the State. Under the decree, access to the beach areas for recreation is suspended at the state level until October 26, 2020; the operation of changing rooms and floating; in addition to the operation of bars, even if in the restaurant mode.

In the latter case, it applies to establishments that are not, until the publication of the decree, registered as a restaurant, in the main classification of the CNAE (National Classification of Economic Activities). Restaurants and snack bars will be able to operate until the 22:00 deadline, being forbidden to reopen after this time, until 7:00 am of the following day, as well as its lease for the organization of events and private parties.

The decree also prohibits the holding of events in nightclubs, nightclubs, concert halls and properties intended for rental for this purpose, such as houses, farms, farms, associations and clubs.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions

description: On April 28, 2021, Brazil's President signed into effect a provisional measure that allows employers to implement alternative labor measures to "preserve employment, job market sustainability, and combat the consequences of health state of emergency due to COVID-19". description: On April 28, 2020, Brazil's President enacted a provisional measure that allows employers to restrict the number of working hours as long as hourly wages are kept the same and for a maximum period of 120 days. Wage and working hour reductions must be in one the following proportions: 25%, 50% or 75% and must be defined up to two days before the start of the 120 day period and reinstated to normal wages up to two days after.

link: Art. 1º – Fica prorrogado o término da vigência dos convênios de saída, termos de colaboração, termos de fomento, acordos de cooperação, termos de outorga, convênios para pesquisa, desenvolvimento e inovação – PD&I e outros instrumentos congêneres celebrados pela Administração Pública direta e indireta do Poder Executivo cuja vigência tenha se encerrado ou a se encerrar a partir da data de publicação deste decreto, enquanto durar a SITUAÇÃO DE EMERGÊNCIA em Saúde Pública no Estado, declarada pelo Decreto NE nº 113, de 12 de março de 2020. § 1º – Será de trinta dias, contados do encerramento da SITUAÇÃO DE EMERGÊNCIA, a data do término de vigência do instrumento prorrogado, nos termos do caput. § 2º – O instrumento cujo objeto verse sobre evento poderá ser prorrogado por até um ano a contar da data de término atual. § 3º – A prorrogação a que se refere o caput não implica renovação do vínculo, o que deverá ser realizado por meio de instrumento específico, se for o caso, devendo ser executado apenas o saldo do convênio, termo ou outro instrumento congênere existente, vedada qualquer modificação de valor. Art. 2º – A prorrogação de que trata o art. 1º deverá ser tramitada no Sistema de Gestão de Convênios, Portarias e Contratos do Estado de Minas Gerais – SIGCON-MG – Módulo Saída ou no respectivo sistema gerencial, dispensadas a análise jurídica e a assinatura do representante legal dos parceiros. Art. 3º – O prazo para a apresentação da prestação de contas final dos instrumentos prorrogados nos termos do art. 1º deverá ser contado do encerramento da nova vigência. Art. 4º – Ficam suspensos os prazos de monitoramento, avaliação e prestação de contas relativos a convênios de saída, termos de colaboração, termos de fomento, acordos de cooperação, termos de outorga, convênios para pesquisa, desenvolvimento e inovação – PD&I, termos de parceria, contratos de gestão e outros instrumentos congêneres em curso enquanto durar a SITUAÇÃO DE EMERGÊNCIA. Parágrafo único – A suspensão a que refere o caput aplica-se a prazo concedido à Administração Pública direta e indireta do Poder Executivo e ao parceiro. Art. 5º – Ficam suspensos os prazos de processos administrativos, de qualquer espécie ou natureza, para o interessado, o processado e a Administração Pública direta, autárquica e fundacional, no âmbito do Poder Executivo, até dia 30 de abril de 2020, em consonância com a diretriz prevista na Resolução nº 313 do Conselho Nacional de Justiça, de 19 de março de 2020. § 1º – A contagem dos prazos de processos administrativos recomeçará a partir do primeiro dia útil seguinte ao término da suspensão. § 2º – O disposto no caput não impede: I – o exercício de competências internas que possam ser realizadas por meio eletrônico, assegurada a ampla defesa e o contraditório ao interessado e ao processado; II – o exercício voluntário de atos processuais pelos interessados e processados, respeitadas as limitações decorrentes da SITUAÇÃO DE EMERGÊNCIA. § 3º – Ficam excetuados do disposto no caput os procedimentos licitatórios, de contratação direta, doações e quaisquer procedimentos que visem aquisições de bens ou serviços. § 4º – A autoridade responsável pelo procedimento a que se refere o § 3º poderá suspender as contratações não essenciais, desde que o faça motivadamente. § 5º – Fica suspensa a realização de audiências e sessões de julgamento no âmbito administrativo. § 6º – Este decreto não se aplica aos processos administrativos tributários, que serão objeto de regulamentação específica. Art. 6 – Os órgãos e entidades poderão expedir atos regulamentares para disciplinar as especificidades dos convênios e processos administrativos de suas competências, mediante prévia análise jurídica da Advocacia-Geral do Estado. Art. 7º – Este decreto entra em vigor na data de sua publicação, retroagindo seus efeitos a partir de 16 de março de 2020. Belo Horizonte, aos 19 de março de 2020; 232º da Inconfidência Mineira e 199º da Independência do Brasil. ROMEU ZEMA NETO

description: Minas Gerais makes budget cuts, prohibiting all capital expenditures which use money from the State Treasury as well as trainings, break time snacks and food, events, seminars. Other restrictions include no new consulting services and real estate agreements. Agencies must reduce real estate expenses by 90%, purchase of consumables and warehouse items by 50%, public utilities (water, electricity, gas, postal, phone) by 80%, travel expenses by 40%, vehicle costs and maintenance by 50% and all other expenses by 25%.

description: On May 10, 2020, Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) "institutes the Controlled Distance System for the purpose of preventing and dealing with the epidemic caused by the new Coronavirus". It makes mandatory to every establishment, private or public, the observation of sanitary measures. Establishments must adopt schedules and shift changes systems to reduce the number of employees at the same time, as well as offer exclusive hours or sectors to serve customers aged sixty or over and those at risk.

description: On August 24, 2020, the President of Brazil converts Provisional Measure No. 945, of 2020, into Law No. 14047, of August 24, 2020. This law provides for: (i) special measures to face the Covid-19 pandemic in order to guarantee the preservation of port activities, considered essential; (ii) assignment of special use of patios under military administration; and (iii) costing of the expenses with parking services for the permanence of aircraft of national companies of regular air transportation of passengers in the yards of the Brazilian Airport Infrastructure Company (Infraero).  This measure states that the temporary use contract will have a non-extendable term of up to 48 months.

UPDATE: On August 24, 2020, the President of Brazil converts Provisional Measure No. 945, of 2020, into Law No. 14047, of August 24, 2020. The adaptations made by the Parliament will bring more flexibility in the management of public ports, favoring the rationalization of the use of space, attracting investments, as well as increasing efficiency and expanding cargo handling capacity.

description: On May 10, 2020, Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil) "institutes the Controlled Distance System for the purpose of preventing and dealing with the epidemic caused by the new Coronavirus". It makes mandatory for everybody the observance of social distance, restricting circulation, visits and face-to-face meetings of any kind to what is strictly necessary, as well as the observance of a minimum interpersonal distance of two meters. It is mandatory the use of face protection masks at collective rooms or public spaces.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: On December 17, the Brazilian Ministry of Health signed a decree (Portaria 456) comprising of social distancing measures to be adopted at airports and aircraft. description: Announced on the 27th of January, 2021, the state of Rio de Janeiro announced that presencial classes will return on the 24th of February through 3 phases. On the first phase, pre-school children, 1st and 2nd grade will return; on the second phase, students from the 3rd to the 6th grade and of the 9th grade will return; and finally on the third phase, the remaining students.

description: Announced on September 2nd, 2020, the Ministry of Public Health of Uruguay made public that on September 1st, Uruguay and Brazil had signed a joint monitoring agreement for COVID-19 which stated that the cities of Artigas, Quaraí, and Barra do Quaraí Bella Unión would work together as health units for the treatment and monitoring of COVID-19.
